intro: Argythamnia dioica, commonly known as the two-colored thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, while the leaves are covered in fine hairs. Argythamnia dioica is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
